content.heroIntro: Welcome to ALAIA VILLAS, an exceptional residential development by GROUP UNO located in the prestigious Lo Pagan area of San Pedro del Pinatar, Murcia. This carefully curated collection of 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom villas represents the pinnacle of modern Mediterranean living, combining contemporary design with traditional Spanish charm. Each villa spans 159m² of meticulously planned living space set on generous 502m² plots, offering the perfect balance between comfort and privacy. Delivered in December 2026, ALAIA VILLAS offers discerning buyers an opportunity to invest in one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after coastal communities, where established international residents enjoy year-round sunshine, world-class amenities, and proximity to pristine Blue Flag beaches. GROUP UNO's commitment to quality construction and attention to detail ensures these villas will become cherished family homes or exceptional investment properties for those seeking authentic Spanish coastal living with modern comforts.

locationSection.intro: Lo Pagan is a charming coastal enclave within San Pedro del Pinatar, renowned for its authentic Mediterranean character and thriving international community. This picturesque location perfectly balances tranquility with convenience, offering residents direct access to stunning Blue Flag beaches while maintaining proximity to essential services and entertainment. The area has become increasingly popular among expatriate buyers seeking genuine Spanish coastal living without the overdevelopment of major tourist resorts. Lo Pagan's established infrastructure includes excellent healthcare facilities, international schools, and a vibrant expat community where English is widely spoken. The town's strategic position on the Costa Blanca provides easy connectivity to Alicante International Airport and access to the region's renowned championship golf courses, making it ideal for families, retirees, and investors alike.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain with relatively few restrictions. Non-EU citizens require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), which is straightforward to obtain. Most nationalities face no legal barriers to property ownership. We recommend engaging a Spanish-speaking solicitor to navigate legal procedures and ensure compliance with all regulations.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, Spanish property acquisition typically includes: Transfer Tax (6-10% depending on region), Notary fees (0.5-1%), Land Registry fees (0.1-0.5%), and legal fees (0.5-1%). For ALAIA VILLAS in Murcia, expect approximately 8-12% additional costs. Our team can provide detailed cost breakdowns and financing guidance for your specific situation.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Property purchase does not require a visa. However, if you plan to reside in Spain as a non-EU citizen, you may need appropriate residency documentation. The Spanish Golden Visa program (Visa de Inversión) offers residency to property investors meeting specific criteria. Consult your embassy or our specialists regarding your specific residency requirements.

faqs.question: How much are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Annual property taxes in Spain include: IBI (Municipal Property Tax)—approximately 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value annually; Non-resident tax—19% for non-residents earning rental income. For ALAIA VILLAS owners, annual IBI is typically €400-600 depending on final valuation. Rental income from holiday lets incurs standard Spanish income tax rates. We provide complete tax guidance during the purchase process.
